cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift west on Thursday, then turn WNW Friday and NW Saturday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then inland toward Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City / Intracoastal City, LA

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch, Tropical Storm Watch, Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, LA; Tropical Storm Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River northward to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Watch from the Mouth of the Pearl River to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward to the western Florida Panhandle, with greatest impacts expected along the Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–45 kt) possible at the port beginning Friday night into Saturday with a low (8%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 3–6 ft inundation possible along low-lying areas near the Mississippi River and Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches of additional rainfall with isolated totals to 20 inches are forecast for the New Orleans area, where 6–9 inches have already fallen, leading to significant flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Freshwater and river flooding (Mississippi River already high) and a low risk of tornadoes in outer rain bands.
